ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re-discover links
ygData.msgSnippet: All the outlinks discovered from a URI are inside the CrawlURI during its processing, until it is finished (and logged in the crawl.log). If you use the

All the outlinks discovered from a URI are inside the CrawlURI during 
its processing, until it is finished (and logged in the crawl.log).

If you use the WARCWriterProcessor, they are part of the data written in 
the 'metadata' record associated with the URI.

Alternatively, you could insert your own custom processor to log this 
data somewhere else (using the WARCWriterProcessor's writeMetadata 
method as a model).

In this way, you can get the link data you want, without revisiting the 
same URLs many times (indeed infinitely via link-loops!).

- Gordon @ IA

On 2/28/11 3:16 PM, HONGYING YI wrote:
> Hi Gordon,
> We want to know all the out-going links and in-coming links for each
> page, and in the example, for aol.com, aolhealth.com is an out-going
> link for aol.com, and drugchecker.aolhealth.com is an in-coming link for
> aol.com. If the link from drugchecker.aolhealth.com to aol.com does not
> show up, we will not get all the in-coming links for aol.com. Is there
> any way to retrieve that link? Can any configuration setting in the
> crawl get round that?
> Thanks!
> Yang
>
>
>
> --- *11年3月1日，周二, Gordon Mohr /<gojomo@...>/* 写道：
>
>
>     发件人: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
>     主题: Re: [archive-crawler] Re-discover links
>     收件人: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
>     抄送: "y195322" <y195322@...>
>     日期: 2011年3月1日,周二,上午6:33
>
>     On 2/28/11 10:20 AM, y195322 wrote:
>      > Hi!We are doing web crawling using Heritrix, and found one issue
>     in that once a link has been 'discovered,' it won't be
>     'rediscovered.' This means that if we have something like:
>      > aol.com->aolhealth.com
>      > aolhealth.com->drugchecker.aolhealth.com
>      >
>      > and if drugchecker.aolhealth.com links to aol.com, that link will
>     not show up in the file.
>      >
>      > Is there any way to fix this problem? Thanks!
>
>     Usually a single snapshot crawl only wants to retrieve each URL
>     once, so
>     this is by-design, rather than a problem.
>
>     Why do you want to fetch aol.com twice in a single crawl? (Or am I
>     misunderstanding?)
>
>     - Gordon @ IA
>
>
